verses.roman:
dāsya-bhāve ānandita pāriṣada-gaṇa
vidhi, bhava, nārada āra śuka, sanātana

synonyms: dāsya-bhāve—in the conception of being a servant; ānandita—very pleased; pāriṣada-gaṇa—all the associates; vidhi—Lord Brahmā; bhava—Lord Śiva; nārada—the great sage Nārada; āra—and; śuka—Śukadeva Gosvāmī; sanātana—and Sanātana.
translation: All the associates of Lord Kṛṣṇa, such as Brahmā, Śiva, Nārada, Śuka and Sanātana, are very much pleased in the sentiment of servitude.
